GapFillInput.Title: Descriptive adjectives
GapFillInput.Instruction: Work out the anagram at the end of each sentence and then fill the gap.

Content.Question:
1. I found Kasia’s house rather cluttered. There were ornaments, pictures and other stuff all over
the place. (edrettclu)
2. Theo looked really scruffy for his interview. He didn’t polish his shoes and he forgot to iron his
shirt! (ffyurcs)
3. I prefer a minimalist approach to home décor. It makes it feel like there is more space. (listmainmi)
4. Part of the fun of going to a big party or celebration is getting dressed up beforehand. (sdeserd pu)
5. Alicia prefers modern and contemporary paintings rather than the older classical paintings. (rarpemyotonc)
6. Joshua has a very unconventional way of dressing; he never follows fashion, and always looks different
to everyone else. (nocunvenoitnal)
7. My aunt is a very sophisticated lady; she dresses in a very chic way and is very well informed on the world
of art and literature. (tedicathispos)
8. The family usually get together for a traditional Sunday lunch at my parents house. We enjoy roast
potatoes and a joint of roasted meat. (naltioaditr)
9. Amy loves loud psychedelic patterned shirts. (elichedsycp)
10. I find it really irritating when people at work e-mail to talk about a problem rather than actually
talking to the person. (ingatrriti)
